body: @SirIntellegence I opened a new PR (see #851) as I noticed problems while doing manual testing and decided to look closed at the mercurial annotate command. The PR decriptions holds some more information. It would be great if you could give it a look. Thank you.
The upstream repo changed its directory structure, which means the pull request got a merge conflict. Now trying to figure out how to merge or rebase it from my side...

I rebased (and force-pushed) this pull request since changes in the upstream directory structure caused a merge conflict.

I've had the patch enabled (together with https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/603 ) in both my development IDE and my NetBeans Platform application for about a week now, with no ill effects, so I think both of these pull requests are ready to be merged.

I rebased (and force-pushed) this pull request since changes in the upstream directory structure caused a merge conflict.

I've had the patch enabled (together with https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/598 ) in both my development IDE and my NetBeans Platform application for about a week now, with no ill effects, so I think both of these pull requests are ready to be merged.
Looks good to me. Thank you.

`CDDL-GPL-2-CP` means that licensor licenses the artifact under CDDL and GPLv2 with Classpath Exception.  As the licensee you can choose which license you choose and at this time GPLv2-CP is not cleared, but CDDL is, so we elect that. So declare the licenses as CDDL (version needs to be determined) and only include that license text.
I'll do the adjustments @junichi11 requested and then merge. Thank you.

Thanks matthiasblaesing . i will used CDDL 1.1 license 

license mentioned in the maven repo(https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/javax.enterprise.deploy/deployment-api/1.2-rev-1) is 
 https://glassfish.dev.java.net/nonav/public/CDDL+GPL.html which is CDDL1.1
I'll address @junichi11 comments and get this merged. Thank you.

Reworked the patch using a more conservative approach. Also fixed the null ActionEvent issue by using SwingUtilities.notifyAction instead of calling actionPerformed directly. Manually tested on Windows and MacOS, including verifying that Escape can still be invoked to close popups, that code completion arrow navigation works properly, and that the "Enter" and "Space" shortcuts to pin or expand debugging tooltips from https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=262311 still works.

Also rebased to fix merge conflict with upstream's new directory structure.
Approved
Thank you - merging.
Just a moment while I make sure it works with what I have...
Looks good to me.
Thanks for checking!
given that #844 is merged, is this ready to merge as well ?
For me, this looks good. Does anyone have comments?
There are conflicts here to be fixed before merging.

I agree that it looks good. We should be prepared for a discussion at release time with the IPMC, as we have GPL depdendencies in the codebase (I know that is not build with the cluster exclusion, but the last time the replies were not to reasonable). That said, we I would merge it as is.

I was reminded about this from PR #856. We will need a solution for GPL/LGPL dependencies and I would like to postpone the merge of this. We should pull the "we are incubating" joker for release idiscussions. I think we showed good faith and the netbeans project is well setup with license tracking (better in parts than some graduated apache projects ...).
OK, merging.
How confident are you of this, do you foresee any potential problems or side effects?
OK, merging.
Is this ready, can it be merged?
Quite confident--I don't foresee problems, and I've tested it on both Windows and Linux (the code is not used on MacOS).
OK, merging.
Seems good, no reason not to go ahead and merge this. If something breaks somewhere, we know it's from here.
@geertjanw , we can merge this as soon as Reema reviews this.
Looks fine to me, please ensure var related tests are all passing.
To me, looks great, thanks for this work.
I have tested var related tests with the new changes and all of them seem to be passing.
OK, let's merge. Thanks a lot for your hard work on this!

Based on the fact that your previous restructurings have gone so well and you're an expert at this at this stage, and the fact that the checks have passed and there are no conflicts, let's merge this -- and if the build breaks we can take another look; thanks for the great work.
Rebased on latest master (`webcommon` cluster has moved`)
Good timing, applied this, and was able to build Apache NetBeans 'basic' distro, with ${clusters.config.php.list} added to line 29 of cluster.properties.
@matthiasblaesing Thanks for catching it. Fixed.
Awesome, this means 'ide.etc' will be gone completely after this is merged?

Talked with John Brock, product manager of Oracle JET, and he agrees with this approach. All checks have passed, there are no conflicts, I have built the sources with this change, and the project templates aren't shown anymore, so everything is good, and I am merging this.

If they are outdated, please remove the code completely and I would also remove the referenced templates themselves (I assume, that they are only reachable on this way). Else in a few weeks nobody will remember why the files are still there and nobody will cleanup.
I understand what you're saying. Note though that I am here, I'm an Oracle JET product manager, so I won't forget that these templates are here, will be actively developing html.ojet module further.
Although, if you feel strongly, will do what you're suggesting here. I must say I don't feel very strongly about this in this case in this module.
I believe in your words, so I can live with the situation :-)
Yes, 'ide.etc' will be completely gone :)

There are conflicts. Please synchronize the master branch of your repository with the upstream repository(incubator-netbeans) before you create a new branch. (see "Keeping your own fork in sync with Apache GitHub repo" section: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=74681408)

Then, Did you run tests? You should do it because you added the license headers to test data. If tests fail due to adding them, you should not add them. They are already excluded from the rat.
And everything still works, builds, etc?

It seems that [rat report](https://builds.apache.org/job/incubator-netbeans-linux/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/nbbuild/build/rat-report.txt) has `/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/incubator-netbeans-linux/platform/libs.javafx/external/lib-javafx-13.03-beta.nbm`

Not sure if it helps - I had a look at the unittests - there are three:
- PlistTest + ProvisioningTest worked before and after your changes
- IOSPlatformTest fails before and after

`IOSPlatformTest` fail is not related to the XML files, it fails because the whole IOSPlatform code works only on IOs (the libraries as dylibs).

I would merge as is.

I incorporated sdedic's comment and pushed again. (After having to rebase and force-push to fix the directory structure merge conflict, it seems I have to force push again to get the pull request updated. Sorry--I hope it doesn't make the PR history too confusing.)
Great.
This should solve problems in building specific cluster, e.g., the groovy cluster, as experienced by @svenreimers?

I have been running with this patch for a couple of weeks now. I *think* it has removed a lot of previously very annoying errors, or at least saved me from doing a complete clean build every time they occur ("Annotation: An error occurred during parsing", "Absent Code attribute in method", "The bytes do not represent a valid class" etc.)

Does this patch impact "Apply Code Changes" in any way? (That feature has always been very flaky... yet it is so incredibly useful that I use it anyway.)
@geertjanw, yes, this should fix that.

The change itself looks sane. The removed implementation looks like a direct copy from the JDK implementation, so switching to the JDKs default implementation is sane.

I'd like you do adjust the commit though:
- the summary (first) line of the commit should hold the referenced issue in brackets as first element
- as the name suggests the first line should give a summary of the change (why was it done)
- then an empty line should follow
- the rest of the message should give a reasoning for the change

In this case:

```
[NETBEANS-1252] Fix shifted cursor in output window with GDK_SCALE=2

Remove custom implementation of #viewToModel and# modelToView methods, ....
```

You can update the message by amending the commit and doing a force push of the branch the PR is based on.

A final comment: You introduced changes not directly related to the fix (whitespace removal + constant introduction). They are sane, but in general that should not be done. (in this case keep it, as I already looked through it).
Shouldn't jdk-8-check be removed from nbbuild/templates/projectized.xml for this to work?

I'm missing something, because I just build the module without the patch. What is the sequence to trigger the mentioned bug? Can the issue be triggered if using the netbeans ant harness or do you need to work around the build system?
Merging the approved PR. Thank you both for creating + reviewing this.

Note that this PR introduces a new public class VectorIcon in the openide.awt module, so it should increment that module's API version before being merged.

(I don't think I have permission to add the "API Change" label to the pull request.)

So now, everyhing should be fine now. The SplitAction.java file only removes some Bundle messages.

Atm, I don't know why is the SplitAction completely red and green again but finally, it shouldn't matter now. Everything was discussed earlier. Please merge now.

Hm, I closed the file and reopened it, now it is CRLF, will fix it.
It doesn't make sense to change it now to LF and amend the commit, right? Do I have to do it again? I mean applying the patch and fix the line endings?
If you change line endings, do an amend commit and then force push that should do it.
Got it.
You now lost the commit message :-) - When you amend you need to keep in mind, that you replace the previous commit.
Hm, ok. I thoght they will merged together. The Message too. But this should Not be a Problem now. Now I know it and will make it better next time :).

Why wait? An amend commit is possible without any file changes, so you can still fix the commit message. Same procedure s before:  Start the amend commit, check/update the message, finish the commit, force push.

>should Not be a Problem now. Now I know it and will make it better next
>time :).
Any objections to merging this?
Any objections to merging this?
So will this not have any effect for any other os?
I believe it enables the system browser to be selected rather than automatically IE being selected.

I had another look at this. The current file is created here (seen in your commit):

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/877/files#diff-b776116ec4c79d0087dad2f3f1fb666a

The file you replace not only holds the JSP api, but also EL and servlet api and schema files. In the referenced build.xml the "instructions" for build the two files (the jsp parser + api) are "documented". You don't need the full glassfish distribution. The EL, Servlet API and JSP API files exist separatedly and the schema files can be extracted from gf-client-module. The latter has a huge number of schemas.

The interesting part will then be determining the final license file. The files look like a mix of CDDL-1.0, CDDL-1.1 and ALv2.
@geertjanw Should have no effects on other OSes, no, since the change is in Windows8LFCustoms.
Done.

Looks better, though I would not choose this message. I would have worded it:

```
[NETBEANS-59] Separate actions for document splitting to enable shortcuts

<Context explaining why it was implemented the way it was>
```

It is a summary what was the desired outcome of this commit, which helps to understand the code changes. If an explanation is required why it was implemented the way it was or context should be provided, the further lines of the message can be used. The context is not always required, but helps to put the understand changes years later.

You can change the message or merge to master as is.

I can understand your point but first, my commit message is exact that, what the commit means. Maybe it is only a wording for sure and I know that, because I do it every day as all of you, But to be clear, the commit message should be as short as possible to explain what the commit makes. Here we only have one commit, but often we have more.

Second, everything else, what is not kind of related to the commit, is written in this ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-59. There is the exact explanation why it was implemented or why I want it or what I want. So If you need further information, look into the ticket.

Thx to all of us with my first apache netbeans PR for the info, help, hints and everything. Next time, I will be more careful. But please don't be that strict to everyone. I think a lot of people can lose motivation. IMHO.  Will merge it now.

To trigger the issue just build under JDK 11. The Messager class [error method](https://github.com/unofficial-openjdk/openjdk/blob/jdk/jdk/src/jdk.javadoc/share/classes/com/sun/tools/javadoc/main/Messager.java#L246) parameters changed from DiagnosticPosition to SourcePosition.

The issue cab be resolve by adding the property  in netbeans_default_options property in etc/netbeans.conf
property: -J-Dorg.netbeans.modules.extbrowser.UseDesktopBrowse=true

Refrerece bug: https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=189525
@matthiasblaesing , great catch. I think that CDDL + GPL 2.0 should suffice as a license for all the four jars. Where do you think ALv2 or CDDL-1.1 might be required?

> Does this patch impact "Apply Code Changes" in any way?

Not sure. I do use that feature (and also find it flaky).

I often use the "Show annotations" functions when working with code bases. Often the commit message holds the information that is necessary to understand why something was done the way it was. I see good commit messages in the same league as good comments: I'm not interested in comments, that just repeat what is obvious, but that give the code some meaning/context (explain the why). In the same sense good commit message give context (summary of the change) and explain why the change was done.

I have yet to see an instance where I took the time to wander through several issue reports, even if they are referenced. Switching to the issue tracker takes time and often issue texts don't help or the real explanation is buried in one of the uncounted number of comments.

Consider the current situation: Oracle could shutdown the bugzilla instance of netbeans right now. If the commit messages are meaningfull and explain the main reasoning, history could be reconstructed from my mercurial clone (or the git conversion of that). The commit history in a DVCS is by definition a good place to give context information.

Don't take this wrong: I appreciate your work and also the stamina to see this through.

I will keep being strict about these things. I have seen code bases, where commits looked like shit and the earlier a contributer learns about good commits, the better for him/her and the project and the commiter.
As there was no objection, I would say: Merge it, we can change it at anytime. Same goes for #869. Thank you.
Any objections to this from anybody?

The changeset looks clean and contained. It could be trivially reverted, so is pretty safe.
I would probably not have noticed the issue, but that is my problem.... f

The main utility of this patch is to prevent certain menus from becoming taller than the entire computer screen. (E.g. the projects menu, which has 29 items... at least until https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-212 is fixed.)
